game

Class Field

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • game.Field
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Field
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This class has a double purpose:
    (1) it defines the field elements (barriers, goal and agent position) and
    (2) it paints the GUI, if necessary.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Field

        public Field(int x,
     int y,
     java.util.Random rd)
        Parameters:
        x - dimension for the field for x-axis (it should be >0 and <= 60)
        y - dimension for the field for y-axis (it should be >0 and <= 40)
        rd - Random generator.

        public double getHoleDensity()

      • setHoleDensity

        public void setHoleDensity(double holeDensity)

      • getLeftGoal

        public Position getLeftGoal()
        Returns:
        the left Position of the goal. Be careful, it is an integer position. For example, if it is (5,0) it will refer to the top left of the left position, in real numbers, for example, the bottom left will be (5,1).

      • setLeftGoal

        public void setLeftGoal(Position leftGoal)

      • getRightGoal

        public Position getRightGoal()
        Returns:
        the right Position of the goal. Be careful, it is an integer position. For example, if it is (6,0) it will refer to the top left of the right position, in real numbers, for example, the bottom right of the right position of will be (7,1).

      • setRightGoal

        public void setRightGoal(Position rightGoal)

      • getMidGoal

        public Position getMidGoal()
        Returns:
        the middle Position of the goal. Be careful, it is an integer position. For example, if it is (3,0) it will refer to the top left of the middle position, in real numbers, for example, the exactly middle of it will be (3.5,0.5). If the goal has an even number of positions, it will provide length/2 as the mid-position, for 6, it will be 3:
        0 1 2 3 4 5 G G G M G G

        public void setGoal(Position left,
           int goalLength)
        Parameters:
        left - indicates the left Position of the goal
        goalLength - indicates how many positions form the goal

      • generateMostSimple3by3

        public void generateMostSimple3by3(boolean post)
        this method generates the most simple field: 3x3, the goal is only one integer position located in (1,0). agent starts at (0,2)
        Parameters:
        post - if it is true, there will be an obstacle in Position (1,1)
